Posts.Content: Dear Nibbsie, Thank you for your answer. I went yesterday for the Biopsy but I won't know for a couple of days. The technicians at the Radiology said that what he probably meant by different was that they were indeterminate.
Posts.Title: stereotactic now excisional biopsy question please 1 2

Posts.Content: Dear Nibbsie, Thank you so much for your kind wishes. I got the results yesterday and they were benign. TG I pray for everyone on this site. I wish you a very happy holiday. Best Wishes, Sweetpeas
Posts.Title: stereotactic now excisional biopsy question please 1 2

Posts.Content: Dear Nibbsie I saw your previous answer to Chis and I was hoping you could give me some information. In 2006 I had microcalcifications that I had a Stero biopsy that was benign. Every year since I have had a normal mamogram. This year it showed new, clustered microcalcifications. The radiologist said they looked different. They are very small even with the magnifying glass. He said that there was a 70-75% that they were normal but if it was something this would be what I would want because it was small and slow. He said I didn't have to make up my mind then about the biopsy (but he didn't say how long I could wait) but I made an appointment to have it done right away. What do you think my chances are since he said they were different? If I have to have a lumpectomy what is invloved? Could this be early stage breast cancer and is there usually a good outcome to it? Thank you so much for your response. Sweetpea
Posts.Title: stereotactic now excisional biopsy question please 1 2
